dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open on a GEIGER COUNTER scanning over a rocky terrain. A SAND STORM blows over the landscape. We are lost somewh in the middle of the New Mexico desert. According to the instrument, the area contains high level radiation... THREE MEN WEARING FULL ANTI-RADIATION SUITS have left the jeep behind to collect samples of contaminated rocks. Not at all worried or bothered by the dust storm or high winds, they walk towards the hills. The man holding the counter stops in his tracks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following his colleague)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...It's something else... It's like the radioactivity is moving around us. The numbers on the dial continue to fluctuate. Where is t intensity coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around, seeing nothing but sand and rock through mask. Suddenly, for no apparent reason, THE GEIGER COUNTER GETS LOUDER AS THE NUMBERS SKYROCKET. In confusion, he taps on the instrument attempting to stabilize it, but the radioactivity continues to climb... He looks up to the horizon obscured by the sand storm - s nothing in sight. He sighs. His colleague is probably right, the Geiger cou simply needs an adjustment... He turns it off when A MAN COVERED WITH BLOOD, HALF NAKED comes out of nowhere and jumps at his face-

dialogues.speaker: HELP ME... HELP ME, PLEASE HELP ME
dialogues.text: Scared to death, the scientist pushes him away and backs The man covered by blood falls on the ground and starts crying, begging for help. The scientist doesn't have time

dialogues.speaker: MASK AND OUT OF HIS FOREHEAD
dialogues.text: Terrified, the man covered with blood watches the scienti dead body-fall to the ground revealing, for a quick secon DARK SHAPE FLASHING IN THE SUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the other scientists continue their work oblivious to the attack. Kneeling behind a rock, they mak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it? With his hand, one of the scientists removes the dust aro some SKELETAL REMAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look human... The strange shape of the bones and skull makes it impossi to tell whether they are human or animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW appears above them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning around) Look what we found. Have you... THE PICKAXE SWINGS THROUGH HIS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: ONLY TO BE SLAMMED AGAINST THE ROCKS...
dialogues.text: Blood splatters on the third man, who steps back suffocat with fear behind his mask. The shadowy figure continues the assault on Man 2, finish him off. Powerless to stop'the massacre, the last scienti runs away in a panic. At the top of the hill, he appears, out of breath. He doe have time to climb the rocks as he is pulled down, scream in his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists' Jeep takes off dragging behind it the thr bodies in their radiation suits and the dead body of the other man...

dialogues.speaker: OPENING CREDITS ON 2
dialogues.text: A thick, juicy steak lands on a hot skillet.

dialogues.speaker: WE ARE IN A 1950'S COMMERCIAL FOR NUCLEAR ENERGY-
dialogues.text: While preparing dinner, the perfect housewife presents th kitchen of tomorrow by praising all the benefits of nucle energy. She is joined by her husband, their children, and their d The entire family sits at the table with big smiles. The frame freezes on this naive image of prosperity and w being. A slogan appears:

dialogues.speaker: "NUCLEAR ENERGY, TRY IT...WE DID
dialogues.text: CLASSIFIED STOCK FOOTAGE replaces the commercial- These new images are of nuclear tests performed by the US Army in the New Mexico desert during the same period-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old mining towns are evacuated by soldiers. Their inhabit are rounded up like cattle and loaded into trucks. Somewhere else, prefabricated towns filled with test dumm are eradicated by atmospheric explosions... Caged animals used for experiments are carbonized by nucl waves. Scientists study the evolution of certain radiated specie In a split second, gigantic craters are formed in the mid of the desert. Explosions destroy everything in their path leaving behin only a giant nuclear mushroom, beautiful and terrifying.. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: The sharp outline of the hills appears with the first mor light. The sun begins to rise revealing- A long deserted horizon stretching out endlessly. Nothing lives in this and wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A road curves through the desert terrain. On the side of the road, at the bottom of a hill, a gas station has survived years of wind and dust. Around the main building, a tool shed, three gas pumps, a dilapidated well, a water tower, and gutted carcasses of from the 1950's accentuate the desolate feeling which prevails in this place. A sign reads "LAST STOP FOR 200 MILES". A few tumbleweeds roll across the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beams of light slice through the shutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRIIINK KRONK - a metal grinding noise is heard outside. KRIIINK KRONK - the noise becomes regular. In the darkness we discover a room hardly furnished. The withered and yellowed wallpaper flaps slowly in the draft On the dresser, dozens of empty liquor bottles. KRIIINK KRONK - On the bed, THE OLD GAS STATION ATTENDANT lays with his back to the window. KRIIINK KRONK - The noise outside continues steadily with disturbing his sleep. KRIIINK KRONK - Suddenly, the old man wakes up short of breath and looks around trying to locate the noise. KRIIINK KRONK - He looks through the shutters, then quick puts on the top of his gas station overalls. He grabs a SHOTGUN, loading it swiftly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRIIINK KRONK - The metal grinding noise increases as we towards the gas station door. The door opens and the old man walks out holding his gun. Nobody. Silence has returned. The metal grinding is gone. The lever from the water well still moves. IT'S JUST BEEN

dialogues.speaker: USED
dialogues.text: Hidden behind the house someone or something observes the station attendant walking slowly to the well. DRIP... DRIP... DRIP...- water falls on the palm of his h Worried, the old man scans the surroundings. HE IS NOT ALONE.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Ruby? Is that you?! Ruby? The sun is already high above, the heat waves shimmering the desert. The old gas station attendant moves away from the road towards the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops by a broken fence which is bent halfway to the ground. On a rusty sign next to an atomic symbol, we can

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (towards the hills)

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: On the side of the hill,-THE ENTRANCE TO A CONDEMNED NINETEENTH CENTURY MINE. He approaches the mine and looks through the wooden plank barring its entrance.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: His echo is the only sound that can be heard from the depths... He aims the shotgun, ready to open fire.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKSHOT FOR YA... YOU HEAR ME
dialogues.text: Behind the gas station, someone observes the old man comi back to the house. AN EXPENSIVE LEATHER BAG was placed in front of his door during his absence. The old man looks-around terrified. Diligently, he enters the house leaving the bag on the ground. On second thought, the door reopens and the bag is dragge inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shutters are all closed leaving the station in darkne The old man throws the leather bag on the dining table an sets down the shotgun. He takes a cigar from an ashtray and lights it. He grabs whisky bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a solid gulp, he turns on a bare light-bulb hanging over the table, and stares at the bag in silence. One mor swig for courage, and the old man empties the bag on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewels, a Swiss watch, a DV Cam, glasses, several cell phones, a pager, loose cash, credit cards, a wallet...

dialogues.speaker: .A FEW GOLD TEETH, AND AN EAR ON WHICH HANG GOLD EARRINGS
dialogues.text: He grabs the wallet and pulls out a photo already stickin out. On the bent picture, we see a young couple kissing. The y woman wears the same earrings found on the severed ear... The old man heaves a sigh before putting the wad of cash his pocket. Outside, a voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE THERE
dialogues.text: The voice is followed by a car horn. The old man quickly gathers the objects from the table returning them to the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 1988 AIRSTREAM TRAILER HOME hitched to A CHEVROLET SUV parked in front of the gas station. BIG BOB CARTER, an imposing man in his late fifties, stan outside the vehicle still honking the horn. The trailer home and SUV with the AMERICAN FLAG waving on side, completes the image - Big Bob is an obvious cliche the middle class Republican father with a touch of John Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the hell is everybody? I'm gonna... Before he can finish his sentence, the old gas station ma appears.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, there you are. Fill it up and check the fluids my friend.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: California? Sure didn't take the fastest road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My crazy husband absolutely had to see the desert.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Nothing to see in the desert. Big Bob glares at the old man who fills up the tank while still chewing on his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's illegal to smoke around a gas station. The old man bursts out in laughter revealing rotten teeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the trailer home, DOUG BUKOWSKI, 32, Lynn's husban tries to fix the broken A/C. His glasses and white oxford shirt drenched in sweat, Dou totally out of his element. This is a guy who has never b out of the city. Using a Phillips screwdriver, he forcibly removes the fro grill to access the mechanism. The heat and incessant BARKING wear on Doug's nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of shit! Why couldn't we fly like normal people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax Doug, please. It's their silver anniversary and they're so happy you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, your parents can't stand me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong. They love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have taken them on a cruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's a great idea. Why didn't you plan it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Lynn grabs the milk bottle from its heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't have even come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, please stop. I never ask you for anything, OK? (she looks at the baby) Well see how happy you are when Catherine comes along on our 25th anniversary. She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be in a shitty trailer home-that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I heard that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat, BRENDA, 17, sleeps against the window. A twig tickles her nose. Without opening her eyes, the young girl slaps her face a chase away a fly. But the twig persists - It's her little brother, BOBBY, 15, teasing her. Linkin P blasts through his iPod. Lynn knocks on the window, interrupting his little game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to use the restroom, it's now or never. Bobby removes his headphones and pushes Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, lard ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the gas station, Brenda plays with AN ALBINO PIGLE tied to a rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, come look at this. Bobby joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the animal) Oh my god! Poor thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two make a perfect pair. Bobby turns to a rusty car and unzips to urinate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pee there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to a small

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, what do you care? Bobby re-zips and heads towards the small wooden outhouse while Brenda plays with the baby pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piggy, piggy, piggy... SOMEONE OBSERVES HER FROM THE CORNER OF THE HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the gas station, Lynn leans on the car giving Catherine a bottle. Big Bob opens the hood while the old man continues to fil the tank. At the same time, Doug comes out of the trailer holding h cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the old man) Excuse me sir, do you have a phone I can use? I can't get a signal around here and... Big Bob interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give. the phone a rest, Bukowski!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Bob, "duty calls"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you haven't put that phone down since we left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why I don't go on vacation. They're lost without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop being at everyone's beck and call, Bukowski. You're the boss, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I'm sure all that important business can wait till next week. Doug gives up. He kisses Lynn and takes the baby from her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing sunblock? The sun's so strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While they are talking outside, a DEFORMED HAND slides in the back window of the SUV. A HAND WITH ONLY THREE STRANGELY PROPORTIONED FINGERS. It moves slowly, snatching BOBBY'S HOODED SWEATER from th back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Annnnaaaaau... Under the car the visitor's feet walk way. They are bare, dirty and covered with dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rays of light pass through the wooden planks. The outhouse is so dirty that Bobby is forced to hold his breath... An EYE peeks between the wooden planks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell Brenda! The eye goes away... He re-zips looking outside. Nobody. When he exits, Brenda appears on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak. She looks at him slightly confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug sits on the porch giving the baby her bottle. The old gas station attendant checks the oil and the wate ,Ethel joins him, holding a road map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far are we from 1-88?

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You're at least six or seven hours away'from there. Ethel gives her husband a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you we should have gone through Santa Fe. You never listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: This is the only southbound road that goes to 1-88. From there you can take the 231 West to California. But you'll never make it before sundown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't bother me. I had night patrol for almost fifteen years...

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Not anymore. Thank God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting a private security firm... The old man turns to Doug-

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You a cop too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who me? No way. I'm in telecommunications. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Huh...Make money in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's gotta have a cell phone...

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Well you won't find any customers around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding... As the old man closes the hood, a familiar sound returns-

dialogues.speaker: KRIIINK KRONK
dialogues.text: He leans over and catches Bobby and Brenda in the distanc playing with the well. Brenda is about to drink from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (shouting to them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll get sick.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: Big Bob walks to the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do -I owe you? The old man looks at the gas pump.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: 36 dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me pay, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your money Bukowski, I can still afford.the gas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another room behind the counter, and the beaded curtain which separates the two rooms is still moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty? Come on, sweetie... No answer. Cautiously, Lynn moves through the store to the beaded curtains. Above the cash register, an old sepia photograp a miner stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty? Lynn goes into the other room. In the darkness, among the old empty bottles, she finds Beauty standing with her front legs on a window sill and barking to the backyard. Lynn looks outside- Nobody. Only the desert and hills. Inside the room, THE HALF OPEN EXPENSIVE LEATHER BAG layi alone on the table awakens her curiosity. As she goes to inspect it, she hears the SUV starting and Doug calling out-

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey!? We're leaving... Lynn grabs the dog by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Beauty. There's nothing here... She turns around and runs into- THE OLD GAS STATION ATTENDANT, STARING AT HER.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: May I help you miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, our dog got out...She won't stay put... A car horn breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Honey? What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: I'M COMING
dialogues.text: The old man lets her pass with the dog, watching her WITH SUSPICION- Has she seen the contents of the bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the gas station window, we see Lynn leaving with dog. Outside, next to the rusty abandoned cars, THE PIGLET HAS DISAPPEARED. Only the rope remains. A MURMUR IS HEARD AS A SHADOW PASSES SLYLY ON THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn puts the dog in the trailer where Doug and Bobby are She enters the SUV. Behind the wheel, Big Bob turns aroun one last time before driving off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! KNOCK KNOCK The old man knocks on the window. Big Bob ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it illegal to have people in a trailer while you're driving, "my friend"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fully aware of the driving laws.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Have a safe trip. Big Bob smiles back and starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man stops him-

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: You know, it's not on the map, but if you take a right at the road a couple miles from here, it'll lead you through the hills. Probably save you three or four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer drives off in the distance leaving the attend in a cloud of dust. The old man looks to the hills, taking a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE OF THE OLD ABANDONED MINE.
dialogues.text: The camera passes through the wooden planks blocking the entrance and moves into the depths. DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV through binoculars from the hilltops. The binoculars pan across the deserted terrain before stopping on the Carter vehicle, a tiny dot at the end of road. The car and trailer approach. Off screen, we hear ANIMALISTIC BREATHING behind the binoculars. The SUV turns off the main road onto a dirt trail. We see Brenda lifting the gate and allowing the vehicles to acce the path, unaware of the danger lurking about. Brenda gets back in the SUV. It pulls the trailer on the road towards the hills.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ..Lizard?!...Lizard?! Dinner's on the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOGGLE, the man behind the binoculars, talks into a WALKI TALKIE. His voice is rough and deep. His pronunciation is poor and we cannot understand everything he says...

dialogues.speaker: GOGGLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (in the walkie) Just got on the road... A Chevy and a trailer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the scenery through the window blinds. On a wall, photographs of other Carter vacations are reminders of the good times spent in the trailer home. The thermometer reads above 100 degrees. Sweating, Doug h on while the camper bounces over the rough road. Bobby works on the A/C. He has removed the face plate and tries to fix the motor with the screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cleaning his glasses) I tried for an hour but I couldn't get it cold in here. CLICK- the light turns on and the A/C starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! A breeze of cool air circulates through the trailer. On t table, TWO PARAKEETS fly about their strapped-down cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing... The thermostat was disconnected. He turns to Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least we can breathe now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sets down the screwdriver under the sleeper and sit next to the dogs. Doug grabs a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you stopped smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does my sister know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting it with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Bob would kill you if he knew you were smoking in his "88 Airstream"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him too. You want one? Doug extends the pack. Bobby hesitates before reaching fo one, but Doug pulls the pack away at the last moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right, if you start smoking your sister would cut my nuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) It's cool that you came with us. It's a drag when it's just us and our parents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I like seeing your parents... Bobby is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .in pictures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a "too perfect" blue sky, the Carter vehicles pass through the barren landscape, lifting a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I think we're somewhere on this blue road...

dialogues.speaker: LYNN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom, we're not on the blue road or any other road. He said it wasn't on the map, remember? In the distance, A LIZARD moves through some rocks before heading across the road unconcerned by the approaching ca

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad, you shouldn't have listened to that guy. We're lost.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Look how beautiful it is here girls... The hills, the colors... It's amazing. Imagine the first people who crossed this desert. They had no idea where they were going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do we, Dad. On the road, the Lizard continues carving a dusty path.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIZARD 23
dialogues.text: Close up on the radio dial moving back and forth unsuccessfully in search of air waves... In the back seat, Brenda, annoyed, sits staring at the passing scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't drive so fast Bob, you might lose the camper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .this is fucked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Watch your mouth, young lady. (to her husband) Will you please back me up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming things down) Relax, Mom. We're all just tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You grew up in the 60's. How can you be so uptight?! Still driving, Big Bob turns to his daughters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't like that before... You should've seen her when she was your age. (to his wife) Do you remember honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lizard has almost crossed the road when- SHLING!- RAZOR SHARP METAL SPIRES come out of the ground slicing the lizard in two. A trap has been set: a long chain of retractable spikes h emerged across the road. A few seconds later, the SW drives over them at full spee INSTANTLY, THE TIRES EXPLODE. Big Bob loses control of the vehicle. The car rolls on the rims causing the trailer to almost f over. Inside, Doug loses his grip and is thrown against the sid the trailer. On the road, the spikes retract, disappearing into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CRASHING AGAINST SOME ROCKS.
dialogues.text: Silence. The chain of spikes slithers away in the dust like a snak

dialogues.speaker: NO TRACE REMAINS OF WHAT CAUSED THE ACCIDENT.
dialogues.text: The dead lizard, sliced neatly in half, bakes in the hot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust slowly settles revealing the broken down vehicle Lynn jumps out of the car and runs to the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug? Bobby? Are you alright? Bobby opens the door releasing the barking dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?! Where's Catherine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine. Mom has her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this wasn't gonna be safe for the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heat must have caused a blow out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so... Just a little shaken up. Bobby walks around the car evaluating the damage- The SUV tires are shredded - the rims buried into the gro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they have triple A out here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the trailer, Brenda has gotten out a regained her senses. She takes a few steps, taking in the land surrounding them... The lunar terrain of sand and rocks extends beyond the horizon. In the distance, only the jagged hills are cut o against the sky. Something OMINOUS AND INDESCRIBABLE live this place... Behind the trailer, Doug walks off with his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97% nationwide coverage, and we have to find ourselves in that 3%... He searches desperately for a signal, extending his arm forward. Lynn grabs him tenderly by the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring to the lifeless

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father wanted to see the desert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he's enjoying himself. On his knees, by the SUV tires, Big Bob inspects under th vehicle... Not only are the tires flattened, but the fron axel has buckled from hitting the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to drive with you talking my ear off? I'm pulling a trailer on a dirt road and it's 200 degrees out here! Behind him, Ethel walks with the baby who has stopped cry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so now it's my fault? Doug joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the damage, General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The damn axel is broken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we fix it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what? The frame is completely twisted... Give me your phone, I'm gonna call a tow truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already tried. I'm not getting a signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we use the C/B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That old thing? Give it a try, but this is mining country. Whatever metal is left in those hills will probably scramble the signal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Without answering, Big Bob gets back on his feet, wipes h hands and grabs a bottle of water from the car. After a l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to walk, that's what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk?! But we're miles from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) So we wait here for someone to drive by? Have you seen a car in the last three hours?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred yards away, Bobby has come to retrieve the dogs Beauty and Beast have stopped below a boulder extending twenty feet high. They bark and growl towards the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet this desert is full of rattlesnakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a documentary on The Discovery channel about desert snakes. If you get bit, you'll die in twenty minutes. Big Bob reaches into the glove compartment pulling out a and an extra clip. He hands it to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .or was it five? Bobby grabs the firearm pointing it to the desert. Big Bob grabs another gun from the car, A 44 CHROME PLATE MAGNUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a big smile) I'd like to see how they stack up against this... Ethel brings her husband's jacket and helps him put it on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things never change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loading his weapon) I'll take my bullets over your prayers any day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we'll see scorpions and coyotes? Big.Bob grabs his son by the shoulders, proud. They look two kids getting ready to play Cowboys and Indians. Bobby calls out to Doug, offering the gun-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Doug, wanna try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! No thanks buddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, just one shot, it makes you feel kinda powerful. Big Bob answers for Doug-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone son. Doug is a liberal, he wouldn't touch a gun... Obviously, the two men disagree. Behind the trailer, Brenda sits on a lounge chair in her revealing a sexy body. She applies suntan lotion ready to kill some time. Behind her sunglasses, she observes the silent desert looking like Paris Hilton. Lynn exits the trailer and joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine just fell asleep. How are you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thrilled to be here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is a total drag, especially with a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what they say, next year, I'm going to Cancun with my friends. No more "family trips" for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to have many more trips like this together... As for Cancun, you're gonna have to find a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, with all the money your husband makes, you could at least buy me a plane ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think? Please, for your poor little sister... Doug's voice interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Lynn, can you bring me my jacket honey? Lynn gets up and returns to the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating her sister) "Right away, honey..." Without turning around, Lynn gives her sister the finger. Brenda smiles with satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn finds her husband's jacket and stops when she sees a cigarette butt in the sink. She's pissed. She picks it up throws it away. A FLASH OF LIGHT catches her attention outside. She looks through the kitchen blinds and spots the quick reflection light coming from the top of the hills when-

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY JUMPS UP AT THE WINDOW SCREAMING
dialogues.text: Lynn falls back against.the kitchen table scared to death Bobby laughs, pleased with himself. Annoyed, Lynn shuts t blinds in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Doug and Big Bob look at the road map laid out o the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep walking north. This road's gotta lead somewhere. Lynn comes around with the jacket and sees Big Bob and Bo both holding guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always good to be prepared. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you taking a gun too? Big Bob answers for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only got two and it's better if you guys have one here. You never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're going to be alright? Lynn puts a fisherman's hat on Doug to protect him from t sun and kisses him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't find any help in six or seven miles come back. I'll go to the gas station...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost 3, you'll never be back before sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only about ten miles from here. I'll borrow that crazy old man's truck and use his phone if he has one... Don't worry... I'll be back with a tow truck before nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go with Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stay here with your mother and sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, don't tease your brother, he's in charge now. Holding the gun, Bobby winks at his sister who continues sunbathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Ethel remains silent and worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should pray before you go-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it really too much to ask? (turning to her husband) Bob? Bob finally agrees, and like a good family man, he gather them around. Brenda slips on her shirt and joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God nobody's watching us. In a lowered voice, Ethel recites a prayer. Even though o Ethel takes it seriously, in that precise moment the argu stops and the family seems united and strong. But seen from the surrounding summit, through Goggle's binoculars, the family looks small and vulnerable... Behind them the sun begins to descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine wakes up crying in her crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, little princess. Who doesn't want to sleep anymore? The baby looks at her mother, appeased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry, my angel? Lynn picks her up and exits the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goggle grabs his 1950'S MILITARY WALKIE-TALKIE-

dialogues.speaker: GOGGLE, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Papa Jupe... Papa Jupe... Coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA JUPE'S VOICE, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Wait 'til it gets dark... On the radio, Papa Jupe's voice is deep and distorted. Devilish. Goggle's binoculars POV on Lynn- She sits down with Ethel, unbuttons her blouse and breastfeeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table and fold out chairs are set up in front of the camper. Lynn continues to feed Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't go from the bottle to the breast. At her age she should get used to one or the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, thanks for the advice, but she's my baby. Vexed, Ethel remains quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting to get cold out here, isn't it? (trying to be nice) I can't believe you're spending your anniversary stranded in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can already see the headlines: "Family found dead in New Mexico desert."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place isn't so bad. At least the air is fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it stinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than Cleveland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything's better than Cleveland!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Maybe it was my fault we had this accident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mom. Nothing can stop Dad when he thinks he's found a shortcut. Remember when we ran out of gas on the "shortcut" to the Great Lakes? How old was I? 12, 13?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This family has certainly seen its share of adventures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had just stayed on the main road we'd already be in California...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-what I'd do for a shower and a margarita...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real bed... Bobby sits down at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anybody seen my grey sweatshirt? It was in the car. I've looked everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't touch your smelly sweatshirt. Beast has been pulling on his chain nonstop, while Beauty cries softly from inside the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are the dogs so excited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably some rattlesnakes not far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how Freud would've interpreted your obsession with rattlesnakes Mom? Ethel throws her kitchen towel at him. They laugh. A beat then Ethel becomes sentimental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's going off to college. And then, next year, it's Bobby's turn... The house is going to feel so empty... Lynn grabs her mother's hand-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really happy that we're all together on this trip. Brenda moves to the trailer. Beauty is still barking insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes one of us. They glare at her as she opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, the dogs! Too late. Beauty runs out in the direction of the hills Bobby drops his plate and gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DamГ‚Вўnit, Brenda! Beauty! Worried, Ethel watches her son distance himself from the camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty escapes to the hills. Bobby runs as fast as he can but cannot keep up. The dog further and further away, climbing up the side of the mountain. Beauty moves through the first series of rocks. Bobby los sight of her and stops. Out of breath, he hesitates- Ahead, the rocky horizon shows no indication of a definit path. He spots Beauty climbing between some rocks and continues chase.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTY
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the hill, the rocks are too jagged for h to continue running. He slows down and begins moving past first set of rocks. With much more agility, Beauty climbs quickly towards the top, disappearing behind some rocks.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Only sharp rocks stand before him.

dialogues.speaker: SILENCE AND ECHOES IN THE VALLEY.
dialogues.text: Bobby freezes. No doubt about it - Beauty found what she was looking for and it was much stronger... In the distance, Bobby hears his mother calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few feet from the trailer-

dialogues.speaker: BOB-BY
dialogues.text: Overcome with worry, she turns to her two daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he can hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She couldn't have gone that far. Brenda notices the revolver on the table. Bobby is unarme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to the hills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on a threatening mound of rocks. Bobby must decide- Return to his family waiting by the trailer or continue h search for Beauty? Bobby hesitates, then gathers his courage and decides to confront the hills. Jagged rock after jagged rock, Bobby slowly climbs toward the summit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He appears between two big stones reaching an intermediat zone before the top- A type of NATURAL LABYRINTH formed in the rocks by years erosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty? Beauty? Bobby moves cautiously. He picks up a big stone for protection- A dangerous animal could be hiding behind any corner. A SHADOW PASSES BEHIND HIM.. Bobby doesn't notice. Anaaaaaau - A swift sound of breathing breaks the silence Bobby spins around, ready to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. Just the labyrinth formed in the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty? Bobby is ready to give up when something attracts his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THIN SHADOW ON THE GROUND. Someone or something is hidi behind a rock. Bobby freezes. He stares at the shadow. Who will make the first move? He makes the decision, creeping towards the shadow. Squee the stone, he lifts his hand to strike but stops when he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG GIRL, ABOUT 14, WEARING HIS STOLEN SWEATSHIRT. Sh about five feet tall and frail. The hood covers her head, partly hiding her face. She is rather pretty, even with her ABNORMALLY LARGE EYES... She trembles, frightened and intrigued by Bobby. What is girl doing in a place like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... Don't be scared. I won't hurt you... What are you doing here? The girl keeps silent. Bobby drops the stone to the groun but the young girl remains suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the one who took my sweatshirt? Where did you find it? The young girl smiles shyly. The ice is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? The young girl hesitates and murmurs in a frail voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ru... Ruby... Ruby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here Ruby? Where are your parents? My family needs help. We had an accident. Ruby repeats her name mechanically as if she doesn't understand the questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a low voice) Ru... Ruby... Ruby... Bobby gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you, Ruby... Are you here alone? Ruby won't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby... I'm looking for my dog... Do you understand? My dog... her name is Beauty... She's a German Shepherd, about this high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, have you seen her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby.. _Ruby is Beauty... The last sentence makes her laugh. A STRANGE AGONIZING LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen her? Ruby looks down. She knows something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Ruby... Look at me... Where did you see my dog? Ruby keeps looking to the ground. Bobby reaches under her chin to raise her head. Instinctively, Ruby SCREAMS as she backs off, lifting her hands to protect herself.

dialogues.speaker: ARE NO LONGER HUMAN.
dialogues.text: Frightened, Bobby takes a step back. The girl murmurs sof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I can't understand. What are you saying? He comes closer trying to make eye contact as she continu to murmur the same thing. She too is terrified-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hills... The hills have eyes...The hills have eyes...The hills have eyes... Behind him, a small rock slide grabs his attention. He tu his head. When he turns back to Ruby, she is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby, come back! Once more, Bobby is alone in the labyrinth. On the other side, he finds a trail of blood as if a body been dragged on the rocks. The bloody trail is still fresh and disappears behind ano set of rocks a few feet away. Bobby hesitates, unsure of what he might find... As soon as he's around the outcropping to the other side Bobby sees something that stops him dead in his tracks. Before him, on the ground, is Beauty. Dead. Disemboweled. Bobby drops to his knees, disbelieving, his face turning white. He touches the animal's head as if to convince him that this nightmare can't be possible at all. Beauty's fa is locked in a grimace of horrible pain and shock. And... animal is missing its front right leg. DRIP... DRIP... DRIP... DROPS OF BLOOD fall on Bobby's ha ABOVE HIM, PERCHED ON A ROCK, A FIGURE OBSERVES HIM. A ma with an impressive build crouches like a monkey. He wears clothes covered with dust, and a DERBY HAT on his head. Binoculars hang around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S GOGGLE.
dialogues.text: Goggle has no face, as if it were totally covered with wa He has two little holes for nostrils and no ears. His mou is like an opened wound sliced in his skin. His eyes are only features which give him any human resemblance at all Using his hand, Goggle devours something ferociously-

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTY'S LEG
dialogues.text: Terrified, Bobby runs away. Goggle laughs from his rock. Bobby jumps down the hill. From the summit, Goggle continues feasting. A few yards a Ruby's slender silhouette slides between the rocks. Goggl stops eating, sees Ruby, and throws her the remains. Ruby looks at the half-eaten leg in disgust, and pushes it awa

dialogues.speaker: GOGGLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (rough and deep) What's the matter Ruby.. .You don't like dog anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving at top speed, Bobby descends from the hills, occasionally glancing behind him. He jumps from one rock to the next. Anything to get out o this hellhole. He turns around one too many times and fails to see the s precipice ahead. He tries to stop, but it's too late. Bobby slides down a few feet before grabbing hold of a protruding rock. The rock tears his skin. Bobby tries to climb back up, losing his grip. He falls. His head hits the bottom. He loses consciousness. Behind him a RATTLESNAKE slithers rattling its tail. The snake zips its tongue around his face when -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the hood of the sweatshirt still over her head, RUBY WATCHES THE WOUNDED BOY TENDERLY with her big, abnormal e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on THE RED SUN on the horizon. We hear Doug, singing "California Dreaming" a capella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...All the leaves are brown and the sky is gray. I've been for a walk on a winter's day. I'd be safe and warm if I was in L.A... California dreamin..." After hours of walking down this road, his face shows sig of fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in LA._ California Dreamin..." The lyrics resonate throughout the desert. Suddenly, he s singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?!

dialogues.speaker: IN FRONT OF HIM, ABOUT A HUNDRED YARDS AHEAD, THE ROAD EN
dialogues.text: A mound of earth blocks the road like a wall, extending hundreds of yards on either side. Confused, Doug approaches the wall and starts climbing. Reaching the top, he takes off his sun clips from his gla and tries to grasp what's on the other side- A HUGE ATOMIC CRATER, three hundred yards in. diameter.

dialogues.speaker: TRAILER HOMES, MOTORCYCLES...
dialogues.text: Doug climbs down and wanders between the rusted vehicles. Doug lights a cigarette before continuing his inspection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the reflection of a shattered rear view mirror, we see approaching another car. Dust completely covers the windows. Doug wipes one down t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a baby seat still strapped to the back. The cars all seem to be in good condition, as if they wer simply pushed into the crater. He leans down towards another car- Barbed wire is rolled around the flattened tires... As Doug looks around in confusion, trying to figure out w this place might be, THE CAMERA CRANES UP TO A WIDE AERIA SHOT - revealing five or six others craters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting colder. Lynn warms her hands at a fire in front of the trailer. A few feet away, Brenda collects firewood while calling o her brother's name...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Inside the camper, Ethel watches the sun set in the horiz She cradles the baby in her arms. Brenda joins Lynn and throws some firewood into the flame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the hills) We should've gone looking for him when it was still light out. I'm nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it together Brenda, Mom is already worried enough... The fire will help Bobby find his way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't come back? Maybe he's hurt. Maybe there was an accident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Beauty will find their way back together. Lynn hugs her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought it could be so cold in the desert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby was only wearing a t-shirt when he left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds pass, revealing an almost full moon. Wind blows ar the dark gas station. Between the broken-down cars, we see Big Bob approaching the road. A rusty tea pot sits on a pile of trash and whistles in t wind. By placing his hand on the spout, Big Bob stops the whistling and silence returns. Whistling. Silence. Whistling. Big Bob walks to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: HELLO
dialogues.text: No answer. He knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's Bob Carter, I got some gas from you a couple of hours ago. Still nothing. Big Bob draws his gun and opens the door w SILENCE. From the other side of the house, the whistling has stopp

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anybody there? Answer me! After a few seconds, the whistling returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Bob shrugs it off and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his gun, Big Bob steps into the empty gas station store. A faint light comes from the back room. The wind b dust through the broken windows... Vigilantly, he moves through the empty shelves, behind th counter and past the beaded curtain separating the two ro The light bulb above the dining table is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody home? Hello? Big Bob pushes the last door leading to the back room. His hand feels for the light switch. CLICK - an old lamp comes on in the corner. He finds a wall mounted phone and picks up the receiver. No tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit... Through the window, Big Bob sees a pick-up truck. He starts searching for the keys. Going through the different rooms, he discovers a drawer of money, jewels, watches, credit cards... A REAL FORTUNE He spots a key chain hanging from a nail next to the desk reaches for the keys when something else grabs his attent Partially hidden in the dark, he discovers a few family photos and a few newspaper clippings from the 1950s pinne the wallpaper. Big Bob lights the desk lamp and turns it towards the wal His face goes cold- On the aged photos, we recognize the old gas station attendant in his younger days, next to his wife and his

dialogues.speaker: ABNORMAL CHILDREN GRUESOME AND DEFORMED BY NATURE...
dialogues.text: Cleft lips, tumors, uneven extremities, malformations, sk diseases, and gangrene of the face... THEY ARE ALL AFFECTED BY GENETIC ABNORMALITIES. On a more recent polaroid, we can recognize Ruby at 6 yea old. Besides her three fingers and big eyes, half of her skull is missing or caved in. Another polaroid - in a wheelchair, a little boy has difficulty holding up his hugely disproportionate head. The headline from the clippings makes Big Bob understand origins of these horrors- "New Mexico- Nuclear enters a new age." ".. .Miner town evacuated" "Miners refuse to abandon their lands by hiding in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Military destroys miner's town." The old man's family was. one of those families whose gen lineage was forever changed by the nuclear fallout. Big Bob is shocked, never believing such a thing was possible.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch... Worried for his own family, he grabs the keys and walks o From the bedroom window, we see him running to the pick-u truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Bob slams the door, starts the engine and turns on th headlights. The headlights shine on the outhouse. The wooden outhouse door slams back and forth in the wind Something blocks it from shutting completely-

dialogues.speaker: A FOOT STICKS OUT...
dialogues.text: Big Bob exits the vehicle holding his gun and approaches. A voice comes to him. A MAN SOBBING-

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (through his tears)

dialogues.speaker: IS THAT YOU MISTER
dialogues.text: Big Bob kicks open the door revealing-

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (aiming his gun at him)

dialogues.speaker: MISTER
dialogues.text: The old man seems mad.

dialogues.speaker: OLD GAS ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (lifting his eyes to Big

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife... She didn't want to leave ...she wouldn't move to town even when the state police ordered us to. The kids grew up in the mines... Like animals... (smiling through his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of place is that for children? In a split second, the old man sets the shotgun under his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, VOICES coming from different directions echo ar him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy... Daddy...Daaaddyyy...Daddy.. THE VOICES ARE HORRIFIC AND TERRIFYING. Big Bob backs up pointing his gun in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daaaaddyyy...Dad-dy...Dad-dy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad-dy...Dad-dy...Daddy...Dad-dy... Big Bob can't contain his fear and shoots blindly into th darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? Show yourself! The voices become louder and louder, omnipresent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad-dy...Dad-dy...Daaaddyyy... Daddy.. Daddy... Big Bob walks backwards to the truck, and trips on the ground. Wide eyed, he stands and throws himself on the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, he enters the vehicle and turns the ignition. As the engine turns over-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..Daddy... In a split second, Big Bob sees, in his rear view mirror,

dialogues.speaker: DARK HAIRY FIGURE WITH EVIL EYES IN THE BACKSEAT-
dialogues.text: It's PAPA JUPITER.

dialogues.speaker: BIG BOB'S FACE SLAMS REPEATEDLY INTO THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The truck shakes as Big Bob is attacked inside. Blood splatters on the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodied and screaming, Big Bob is dragged out of the car the dirt to the entrance of the old mine behind the gas station. Big Bob disappears inside. The night is once aga calm and silent. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles away, inside the trailer, Ethel washes dishes while dinner cooks on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKS TO LIFE, DISRUPTING THE SILENCE.
dialogues.text: She wipes her hands on her apron and site down next to th radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the mic) Hello...Hello... Can somebody hear me? Please answer if you hear me. Hello? No answer. The radio goes silent. Lynn joins her, holding baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard something. She fiddles with the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even sure I know how to use this thing. Lynn hands her Catherine, and sits in front of the C/B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the mic) Mayday ...mayday... This is a distress call... Do you copy? Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn's distress call is heard from the trailer isolated i the middle of the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday. . .We're stranded in the desert, we need help...mayday... Suddenly, the light on the C/B turns green and static can heard. Ethel grabs her daughter's hand, hopeful that some may have heard them. A second later, HEAVY BREATHING is heard over the radio. The light turns off. The two women look at each other in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like an animal... Lynn stands up worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If animals start answering our radio calls, we're really fucked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your language!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a rest, Mom. We have more important things to worry about. She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn, wait. Ethel stays alone with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still tied to the trailer, Beast growls and pulls on his chain. Lynn raises the collar of her jacket to protect herself f the wind and moves closer to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: In the distance, we see Brenda looking for her brother.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: With a flashlight in one hand, the gun in the other, and blanket over her shoulders, Brenda moves through the nigh

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She hears her older sister calling.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Brenda? Brenda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here! I'll be back in a minute. The flashlight partially lights the desert as she disappe into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fly over the hills before stopping over Bobby's unconscious body laid out between two rocks. Ruby is still at his side, observing him silently. She hears Brenda's calls and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby slowly opens an eye, regaining his senses. Blood ha coagulated on his face. He turns his head in the directio his sister's voice, realizing that it's night. How long h he been unconscious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is so clear that you can see the milky way above Carters' trailer home. Beast strains on his chain, a low growl of rage coming fr his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the trailer- The first aid kit is open on the table. Even with a blank around his shoulders, Bobby shivers. Ethel soaks cotton in alcohol using it to clean his wound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky Brenda found you. Imagine if you had to spend the whole night out there in the cold. Bobby winces from the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Beauty will come back when she's hungry... Bobby doesn't answer. He keeps the truth to himself, not wanting to worry his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard something. Some sort of breathing... Bobby lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really weird, right mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (minimizing the incident) I'm sure it was just static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it sounded like a perverted crank call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Mom would get an obscene phone call out here! Suddenly,a muted sound echoes outside. Bobby jumps up, grabs the gun and crouches behind the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) Ssshhhh... His mother and two sisters are surprised by his agitated behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? Footsteps. Someone approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern but soft) I want you guys to stay in here. Brenda?! You hear me? Gun in hand, he opens the door- Bobby is about to shoot when a figure emerges from the da IT'S DOUG, holding as much as he could carry from the car graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? Don't point that thing at me. Bobby lowers the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else would it be?! Bobby is interrupted by Brenda who sees Doug from the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug's back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey girls! Quickly, Lynn exits the trailer and jumps into her husban arms. They kiss. Doug sets down all of his findings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found. Various tools, a fishing pole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all of this, we can find a way to fix the car, right Bobby? Bobby doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this really huge crater at the end of the road! I've never seen anything like it! People must use it as a dump site. It was full of all this garbage... (pointing to the fishing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, it's brand new!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with a fishing pole in the desert? You didn't you find anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The road just stops there. I hope your dad has better luck. Is there anything to eat? I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, it's freezing out here. Doug follows Lynn inside the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stays outside, worried. Everything seems calm. Perh too calm. He looks around- BEAST IS GONE. He finds the BROKEN CHAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the hill, Beast has found what's left of Beauty's mutilated body and whines as he licks her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside we see Doug and Lynn finishing dinner while Brenda clears the table. Doug holds Catherine on his knees. Outside, Bobby stands guard with the gun. His mother come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're camping out tonight. How's your head? Bobby doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby? What's going on? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll feel a lot better when dad gets back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, honey. Come inside. You've already spent enough time in the cold for one day, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby agrees to follow his mother, abandoning the fire. The flames dance with the desert wind in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby double bolts the lock on the door. Behind him, Lynn comes out of the bathroom, while Doug has just changed Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't close the door, we're leaving in a second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? You don't want to wait until Dad comes back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired, I really need to rest for an hour or so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can squeeze in here. You'll be more comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to sleep on the floor?! Doug kisses Catherine and hands her to Brenda so she can her to bed. Bobby takes him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Bobby hesitates to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what Bobby? Lynn walks by-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm almost ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... I'm sure your dad will be back soon. He's "Big Bob". It's gonna take more than a few snakes in the dark to stop him, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming, honey? Lynn, holding a blanket and pillows, joins him. They exit together hand in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's not back by midnight, we'll go get him. Deal? Bobby hates himself for not saying anything. He bolts the door shut and stands facing it. Behind him, Brenda sets the baby in her crib and starts a FISHER PRICE MOBILE hanging above, setting off the music rocking the baby to sleep. She disappears in the bathroom for a moment and comes out t-shirt and panties. She turns to her brother-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I listen to your iPod? Bobby is still focused on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow your iPod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever... Brenda grabs it and cranks the volume. she starts swaying the music, unaware of the dangers lurking about. Next to her, Catherine sleeps quietly in her crib. On the other side of the trailer, Ethel works on a crossw puzzle. INSERT- " family, revenge, homicide..." are some of the w in the puzzle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER- Bobby joins her and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In between some bushes, we see the Carter trailer home isolated in the desert under the starlit sky. Backlit in window, Brenda dances... Next to the trailer home, the SUV-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a makeshift bed in the back, Doug is laying on his bac and Lynn rubs his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, Ow... Yeah right there. Perfect. God, I feel like I crossed New Mexico on foot. Amused, Lynn squeezes his legs a bit harder. She moves up his love handles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little work out can't be all that bad for these guys, right? Doug laughs and giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop, you're tickling me! Lynn continues with more fervor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you want to play? He turns around and starts tickling her as well. They lau together before kissing passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too... They start making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same time A HAND opens the gas tank and unscrews t cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In total silence, the hand slips a rubber hose into the t and starts siphoning gas. We follow the hose up to the monstrous mouth of- PLUTO - The deformed bald giant with a child's face. But child with a thick, primal cruelty snapping in his asymmetrical, protruding eyes. Silently, Pluto siphons some of the Carter's gas into a g can. Lynn's hand presses against the window, as she and her husband continue, unaware. Pluto laughs stupidly, excited by the situation. His larg smile reveals POINTY SHARK-LIKE TEETH. Once the gas can is full, he waves at somebody hidden in dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda rests on her bed. Exhausted, she turns off the bed lamp,. and slides under the sheets. She falls asleep list to the music. In the other room of the trailer, Bobby's watch reads 11:45pm. Bobby is restless. He doesn't know what to do. A few feet away, Ethel sleeps on the couch. Suddenly, Bobby hears barking in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beast?! He grabs the gun and exits the trailer, leaving the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby moves into the night. Beast is still barking somewh in the dark. As he passes the SUV, he overhears the moaning and heavy breathing coming from inside. His flashlight moves over the desert terrain and the occasional bush. He calls out to his dog, trying not to w anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beast? Come on, boy. You hear me! Come on now. Bobby moves further from the trailer towards the barking.

dialogues.speaker: BUSHES
dialogues.text: Bobby shines the light on the bush and approaches- Nothing. It must have been his imagination. The barking becomes a ferocious growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beast? Beast? Its me. Come on... All of a sudden the growling becomes a "mooing" cow. Then a goat. Then a chicken. Terrified, Bobby turns around and runs back toward the SU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, Ethel sleeps. At the other end, Brenda turns under the sheets. The mute bass coming from the iPod drums on in the background.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S PLUTO. THE DIVERSION OUTSIDE HAS ALLOWED HIM TO ENTE
dialogues.text: He stands above Brenda watching her sleep, an innocent sm on his face. His hand softly grazes her hair as if she wa kitten, then pulls on the sheets to expose her body. Pluto covers her mouth, silencing her. BRENDA'S EYES OPEN WIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panting and panicked, Bobby knocks on the SUV's tailgate window, interrupting Lynn and Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug! Doug! Caught red-handed, Lynn dresses and Doug pulls up his pan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damanit! What is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the window) What do you want, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, open up! Lynn opens the back window giving him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This had better be important. Bobby is too scared to keep the truth hidden. He regains calm before talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on around here. We're not alone. Exasperated, Lynn takes a deep breath, not taking him seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this sounds weird, but there are people living in those hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby... We're in the middle of nowhere. Believe me, no one could survive out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw them. And Beauty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut out her insides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her guts were all over the place... He struggles to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I didn't want to scare you so I didn't say anything, but something's going on... You even said you heard some breathing on the radio didn't you? Lynn nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not alone, I'm telling you... Doug exits the car. Obviously, Bobby is not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down Bobby, OK? Let's go check it out together. Lynn, stay right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the window, we can see Bobby and Doug walking to the trailer. In the back room, Pluto hears them, grabs his walkie-talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noaowww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THAT MOMENT, an explosion takes place a few hundred ya away from the trailer. The flames climb into the air lighting the surrounding ro desert. SOMEONE SCREAMS. Doug and Bobby turn around.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S BIG BOB
dialogues.text: He has been crucified to a Joshua tree and transformed in HUMAN TORCH... The explosion and the screaming has awakened Ethel who co out of the trailer in her nightgown. Recognizing his scre she runs to her burning husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug tries to hold her back, but she is determined to get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug runs into the trailer grabbing a fire extinguisher a some blankets. In the panic, he fails to see Brenda restrained by Pluto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, stay with Catherine! He jumps out without waiting for an answer. Pluto gives Brenda a satisfied smile- NO ONE WILL BOTHER NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug runs out leaving the door wide open. Someone jumps from the roof and, on all fours, lands in f of the door. He stands and, for the first time, we see th face of - LIZARD - Pluto's cousin. Lizard is as thin as Pluto is imposing. Extremely pale, h face is disfigured by A CLEFT LIP WHICH EXPOSES HIS DEFOR

dialogues.speaker: JUPITER, THE MOST VIOLENT INHABITANT OF THE HILLS.
dialogues.text: Lizard has Big Bob's Magnum. He enters the trailer and cl the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Bob screams as the flames devour his naked flesh. His fingers tighten. His bloodied face distorts with pain Even his eyes are burnt. Considering the condition of his body, it's a miracle he's still alive... Doug arrives with the extinguisher and begins putting out fire under Ethel's horrified, watchful eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back inside the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a wicked smile on his face, Lizard puts on Ethel's a and places her flowery sun hat on his head. This disturbe mind takes pleasure in dressing up in "Mama's clothes"... Then, famished, he eats everything he can find in the trailer. Raw meat, fruit, potato chips... He washes it all down wi milk, orange juice... His eyes stop on the bird cage. He smiles. Lizard moves closer, opens the cage and grabs one of the parrakeets. The small bird looks around in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: HE TEARS OFF ITS HEAD AND SQUEEZES THE BLOOD INTO HIS MOU
dialogues.text: Blood drips on his chin. Brenda's muted screams attract his attention. Lizard walks across the trailer. HE WANTS HIS SHARE. He pushes Pluto violently to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! (with a smile) You gotta be a man to do that... Pluto is outraged and tries to stand up. He wants to talk no words come out. JUST GRUNTS AND GROWLS. Lizard savagely hits him several times. Behind them, terrified, Brenda watches helplessly as they fight. Lizard puts his foot on Pluto's face, pinning him to the ground, and then points the gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told ya to move! Pluto moves away and, in a fit of rage, breaks everything the trailer. Dishes, chairs, table... everything. Lizard laughs like a goon. He grabs Brenda by her feet an pulls her to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited and amused at the same time, he stares at Brenda' appetizing calf muscle. He smells it, licks it, and then, without hesitation, plunges his teeth into her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's muted screams are heard from inside the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames have been replaced by white smoke. Doug unties Big Bob. His body falls motionless to the gro COMPLETELY CARBONIZED, HE HAS STOPPED BREATHING. Smoke comes out of his mouth. Doug uses the blanket to extinguish the last flames. Behind Doug, Ethel looks at her husband refusing to accep the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No..No.. It's not possible. That's not Bob. That's not my Bob. She grabs Doug by his shirt trying to convince him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug.. It's not him. Tell me it's not him. It's not my Bob! The poor woman has lost her mind. Ethel erupts in laughte pointing to her dead husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not my Bob! That is not my Bob! That's not him! Lynn and Bobby are paralyzed. Doug turns to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your mother away from here! With her eyes fixed on her father, Lynn walks her mother away. In Bobby's eyes, sadness has been replaced by hatred. Ful rage, the youngster grabs the gun and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take care of the motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here, Bobby! Bobby disappears into the night. Doug covers Big Bob's face with a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Returning to the trailer, Lynn struggles to restrain Ethe Ethel finally realizes it's too late for her husband and collapses into her daughter's arms. Just then, a muffled scream from Brenda pierces the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Lynn runs inside leaving her mother alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bursting into the trailer, Lynn stops on a dime when she Lizard, in Ethel's clothes, holding the baby. Behind him, Pluto restrains Brenda. Lizard walks up with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
